timeline.message:
chore(starter): remove application property

- was unused code

related to CAM-10623

fix(spring-boot): refactor license key config

* Remove existing, explicit db code and use an Engine API Command to enter the License key;
* Remove redundant tests.

Related to CAM-10591

fix(spring-boot): skip license key write if it exists

Related to CAM-10591

fix(spring-boot): refactor license key config

Related to CAM-10591

fix(csrf): set default of same site property from strict to lax

related to CAM-10791

chore(starter): bump spring boot to 2.1.8.RELEASE

related to CAM-10803

feat(webapp-core): make csrf cookie name configurable


Related to CAM-10845, PR #338

chore(root-pom): update release-parent version to 1.0.0

related to CAM-10891

fix(starter): enable custom context path

* `ServletContextAware` classes with `@Configuration` annotation are not invoked
  by Spring Boot anymore
* work around this limitation by creating a bean in the application that is
  `ServletContextAware` and adjusts the `contextPath` of the application in
  case of a web application

related to CAM-10187

feat(event): dispatch immutable events additionally

* `TransactionalEventListener`s receive mutable data objects `DelegateTask`
  and `DelegateExecution` whose information might already have been altered
  by the time they are handled in the listener, therefore dispatch an
  immutable data object at the creation time of the event that still
  reflects the data at that point in time later
* publish Task UPDATE events
* only add listeners if properties are enabled, otherwise listeners are always
  added and evaluated (the property is then evaluated in the listener)

related to CAM-10588

fix(csrf): exclude login urls as entry urls

related to CAM-10823

chore(deps): bump maven-failsafe-plugin from 2.18.1 to 2.22.2

Bumps [maven-failsafe-plugin](https://github.com/apache/maven-surefire) from 2.18.1 to 2.22.2.
- [Release notes](https://github.com/apache/maven-surefire/releases)
- [Commits](https://github.com/apache/maven-surefire/compare/surefire-2.18.1...surefire-2.22.2)

Signed-off-by: dependabot-preview[bot] <support@dependabot.com>

Related to CAM-10918
Closes #324 PR

fix(webapp): replace rest-core with jaxrs 2 artifact

* pull more functionality than necessary into the starter-webapp-core
  in order to allow arbitrary ordering of artifacts in applications
  using the starter-rest as well, otherwise the fetch and lock
  implementation of the rest-core will be used if the starter-webapp,
  starter-webapp-core or starter-webapp-ee is defined first in the
  application's POM

related to CAM-10613

feat(spring-boot): add jackson java 8 modules for spin 

related to CAM-9972

feat(webapp-core): add property camunda.bpm.webapp.enabled

* To work properly, the Webapp AutoConfiguration needs a configured
process engine
* Before this commit the CamundaBpmWebappAutoConfiguration failed if the
CamundaBpmAutoConfiguration was disabled
* With this commit the CamundaBpmWebappAutoConfiguration is only applied
if the CamundaBpmAutoConfiguration was also applied.

related to CAM-10840

revert(csrf): exclude login urls as entry urls

This reverts commit 44fb7ab4

related to CAM-10823

fix(csrf): exclude login urls as entry urls

This reverts commit 56378fcb

related to CAM-10823

test(qa/webapps): move rest api coordinates to parent pom

test(qa/webapps): change google chrome dependent test name exclusion

related to CAM-10943

feat(engine): add support for new license format

chore(starter): bump spring boot to 2.2.1.RELEASE


Related to CAM-10902

fix(starter): revert enable custom context path

* commit c79a9e0d9face13c80413af6da4f85b73d4c6caa
  introduced a dependency on starter-web for all users of the starter
  because `ServletContextAware` is bound at compile time of
  `SpringBootProcessApplication`
* reverting the behavior, so custom context paths are still not possible
* introducing a simple IT test without web dependencies to make sure a
  new fix does not break this

related to CAM-10187
chore(release): update webapp-ee version for alpha release

revert(release): update webapp-ee version for alpha release

This reverts commit e6451d72

fix(starter): enable custom context path

* add `@Configuration` annotation to `SpringBootProcessApplication`
  because nested `@Configuration` classes are only scanned for
  classes that are annotated with `@Component` since Spring 5.1.x

related to CAM-10187

- before, the Camunda BOM for the CE version was inherited from
  spring-boot-starter-root; this was not correct for that it did not
  use any EE artifacts and that the webjar-ee doesn't exist in a CE
  version

chore(starter): integrate into platform maven structure

* add starter to distro and release profiles in platform
* set platform root as starter's parent
* run starter-qa only in profile `integration-test-spring-boot-starter`
* replace `camunda.version` by `project.version`
* remove separate `camunda-webapp-ee.version`
* run EE modules by default
* remove unnecessary dependency managements
* adjust CamundaBpmVersionTest to not use test.properties anymore

timeline.bodyText: How will this work for CE users trying to build the starter?
timeline.author: koevskinikola
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,178 @@
+<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
+  <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
+
+  <parent>
+    <groupId>org.camunda.bpm</groupId>
+    <artifactId>camunda-root</artifactId>
+    <version>7.13.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
+    <relativePath>../</relativePath>
+  </parent>
+
+  <groupId>org.camunda.bpm.springboot.project</groupId>
+  <artifactId>camunda-bpm-spring-boot-starter-root</artifactId>
+  <name>camunda BPM - Spring Boot Starter - Root Pom</name>
+  <inceptionYear>2015</inceptionYear>
+
+  <packaging>pom</packaging>
+
+  <modules>
+    <module>starter</module>
+    <module>starter-rest</module>
+    <module>starter-webapp-core</module>
+    <module>starter-webapp</module>
+    <module>starter-webapp-ee</module>

replies.bodyText:
It won't, I guess. Question is, if it needs to for now?
In the original starter repo, this was only triggered on release (when an environment variable RELEASE_VERSION was set). It would like to have this run in the CI build as well. What do you think?
We will have a follow-up task to transfer the EE part(s) to the platform EE repo in the near future.
@ThorbenLindhauer, should we provide an intermediate solution if we potentially move the EE parts soon anyway?
replies.author: tmetzke

replies.bodyText: Let's accept it for the time being and then move the EE artifacts to the EE repo.
replies.author: ThorbenLindhauer

chore(spring-boot): bump to 7.10.0-SNAPSHOT camunda version

feat(spring): add additional config options as app.properties params

* Make possible to add some configuration options from bpm-platform.xml as
application.properties parameters.
* Process engine
  * camunda.bpm.default-number-of-retries
  * camunda.bpm.job-executor-acquire-by-priority
* Thread pool task executor:
  * camunda.bpm.job-execution.queue-capacity
  * camunda.bpm.job-execution.keep-alive-seconds
* Job executor:
  * camunda.bpm.job-execution.lock-time-in-millis
  * camunda.bpm.job-execution.max-jobs-per-acquisition
  * camunda.bpm.job-execution.wait-time-in-millis
* If no value present the defaults will be used (though not configured in the Spring Boot starter).
* IntelliJ file based projects added to .gitignore

Related to #299, CAM-9163

* Provide configuration properties for generating unique Process Engine and Process Application names in order to ensure that Application Context caching works properly.
* Rename test/resources/application.properties to application-default.properties. The application.properties file defines "global" properties that are included with every profile. To have a default properties file (when no profile is selected), an application-default.properties file needs to be created.
